p: Also missing from the international human rights framework is empathy for the nonhuman world contained in the perspectives of Indigenous peoples who have curated their environments for millennia. Angela Roothaan notes that Indigenous peoples focus on “how the spirits tell them to maintain an environmental balance with specific local surroundings, out of respect and love for the actual living beings that make up those surroundings, on which human life depends, and which human life can help sustain.”60 One approach to addressing this gap is to ensure that UN human rights treaties are read alongside other UN treaties. For example, although still framed as important for meeting human needs, the Convention on Biological Diversity, the UNFCCC, and these treaties’ respective protocols all promote respect for planetary health and are important adjuncts to the international human rights framework.
